page.title: 12King's Farm, Wendover
page.content: The actual farm has existed in Nash Lee Road for 70 years and the present owners have worked it for 32 years during which time it has been modernised. The family run a farm shop selling meat, eggs, poultry and home produced food. About 200 people use the shop, which is open five days a week. There are 5000 hens housed and five rearing sheds and eggs are ollected and graded by machine. The ings keep 30 breeding cows each of which produce 2 litters of about one dozen piglets a year. All are bred for pork and pork-based meat. About 28 cattle are kept and all the beasts on the site are slaughtered elsewhere before being returned for butchery. This thriving business may lose trade if the proposed bypass cuts off through-traffic.
